article:
'[[Virtuality]]' is the quality of having the attributes of something without
sharing its (real or imagined) physical form.

'Virtuality' also may refer to:
* Virtuality (computing)
* Virtuality (gaming), a family of virtual reality arcade machines.
* Virtuality (philosophy)
* Virtuality (software design), a concept of software design proposed by
  Ted Nelson
* Virtuality (song), a song by Rush.
* Virtuality (TV series), a TV show by Ronald D. Moore
* Virtuality Continuum, a concept in computer science.
* Augmented virtuality, a term that refers to the merging of real world objects
  into virtual worlds
* Real Virtuality (engine), a proprietary computer game engine developed by
  Bohemia Interactive Studio
